title: Eating Around the World in Your Neighborhood
description: A mouth-watering guide to the array of ethnic cuisines popping up in cities and towns everywhere Take a look at the menus of restaurants lining Main Street America and you'll notice a tasty trend. Alongside hamburgers, pizza, and apple pie, you'll find culinary creations from all four corners of the globe. Today's ethnic cuisine explosion gives diners more choices than ever before, whether they live in large cities or small towns. This book is the curious gastronome's guide to the variety of cosmopolitan culinary journeys they can take without leaving the city limits. Geographically organized, it provides recipes and menus from all cultures, explains the dishes, cooking techniques, and ingredients, and lists sources for ingredients and supplies. It also feature interviews with chefs about their food, culture-by-culture dining protocol, and folklore illustrations.
author: Francine Halvorsen
